ICYMI: Select NHS patients will soon be treated with the breakthrough medicine remdesivir, probably the biggest step taken since the #coronavirus crisis began https://t.co/3TEJA1KdPj

Innovation is vital in fighting #coronavirus. We’re starting a new trial for an antiviral drug - remdesivir - which already has some promising results in shortening recovery time.

Details: https://t.co/lAndPAC3jK https://t.co/fdWjmiqagA

One of my proudest moments was when we made a life-saving cystic fibrosis drug - Orkambi - available on the NHS. Now we start the fight for the next generation of cystic fibrosis drugs to save lives:

https://t.co/ZXjxzDSsoV https://t.co/25HnZTNjVg

2/2 Named clinical leads for every care home give instant access to clinical advice

Government supported #coronavirus training programme for support staff

Our testing programme supports all symptomatic & asymptomatic care home staff & residents
Our new portal for #coronavirus testing for care homes widens access for symptomatic and asymptomatic staff and residents. Details: https://t.co/o04RAHwwlP
We’re further widening #coronavirus testing to enable all symptomatic & asymptomatic care home staff & residents to be tested https://t.co/WgxlfKCVsG
@piersmorgan @GMB Sorry to see @PiersMorgan has symptoms of coronavirus. If you test positive, I sincerely hope it’s mild. Get well soon.

Following medical advice, I was advised to test for #Coronavirus.

I‘ve tested positive. Thankfully my symptoms are mild and I’m working from home & self-isolating. 

Vital we follow the advice to protect our NHS & save lives

#StayHomeSaveLives https://t.co/TguWH6Blij

1/2: Really sorry to hear Nadine has tested positive for coronavirus. She has done the right thing by self isolating at home, and both NHS and PHE staff have been brilliant. We all wish her well as she recovers.
I will be on BBC1 at 8pm answering questions about our response to coronavirus Covid-19 https://t.co/ovgK2ohqDc
Prostate cancer has taken too many. This is a positive step forward in our battle against cancer: https://t.co/ocwg7nv1X9
Good news this study has the potential to transform cancer treatment. A promising step in helping all those affected https://t.co/xgQSWyvDPA
We all have friends and family members who’s lives have been affected by cancer - I want to thank everyone in the NHS working together to beat cancer  #WorldCancerDay

Cancer takes lives too soon and affects too many. This discovery is a coup for British science - shows the importance of investment in research 

https://t.co/m9OpYtNNz5
HPV screening & vaccinations will save thousands of women’s lives from cervical cancer - a vital step forward for women’s health https://t.co/pJAnhZrigS

Worth reading this - we’re determined to lead the world in cancer treatment 

https://t.co/pizKpvR4CD

I remember when HIV was a death sentence. So I’m delighted at the 73% reduction in HIV transmissions. 

Good news, but there’s still more to do. https://t.co/PCLm7PFzGk

We will be the first country in the world to access a new cutting-edge treatment for heart disease. 

The revolutionary jab will help with cholesterol and save tens of thousands of lives. https://t.co/0SmsWbjFfU
